thread.title: Tourism Australia launches giant selfie service (VIDEO)
thread.title_full: Tourism Australia launches giant selfie service (VIDEO)

title: Tourism Australia launches giant selfie service (VIDEO)
text:
Tourism Australia launches giant selfie service (VIDEO) Monday August 31, 2015 Print Article 
More than 320,000 Japanese visited Australia in 2014, making Japan the country’s sixth largest market for tourists. — Screen grab from YouTube SYDNEY, Aug 31 — Australia is now offering tourists massive selfies from hundreds of metres away. 
According to The Age , Tourism Australia recently launched the oversized selfie service as part of a campaign to attract Japanese tourists to the country. 
To participate in “GIGA Selfie” events, tourists are required to stand on a predetermined spot and use an app to set off a distant camera. They can then download a short video clip that starts as a close-up, but pulls away to reveal the surrounding landscape. 
“The ‘GIGA Selfie’ campaign will help to raise the level of conversation about Australia in Japan as people share their incredible experiences of holidaying here with their friends and family back home,” Tourism Australia managing director John O’Sullivan said in a statement to Mashable . 
The first two opportunities to take a mega selfie will be in Queensland’s Gold Coast on September 5 and 6, the website added. More Stories for You:
